meanings.sent1: The old, torn book was despised by the students.
meanings.sent2: The despised painting was hidden away in the attic.
meanings.sent3: The despised broccoli magically disappeared from the plate.
meanings.sent4: The despised task loomed over her like a dark cloud.
meanings.sent5: The despised smell of the garbage made her wrinkle her nose.

meanings.sent1: The despised movie was turned off within minutes.
meanings.sent2: The despised bully made school unbearable for many.
meanings.sent3: The despised alarm clock seemed to have a personal vendetta.
meanings.sent4: The despised taste of medicine lingered in her mouth.
meanings.sent5: The despised sound of nails on a chalkboard made her cringe.

meanings.definition: To regard with deep repugnance or aversion
meanings.sent1: She despised the thought of having to clean the dirty dishes.
meanings.sent2: The villagers despised the cruel ruler for his tyranny.
meanings.sent3: The cat despised the new brand of cat food, refusing to eat it.
meanings.sent4: He despised the idea of giving up on his dreams.
meanings.sent5: The detective despised the criminal for his deceitful ways.
